summary: An in-depth documentary exploring activism for internet freedom and campaign reform.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a black screen that transitions to a white background featuring a logo with blue and red elements and the text "FIX DEMOCRACY FIRST" in blue and red, accompanied by two red lines. The scene then shifts to a man in a light blue shirt and glasses, standing against a plain background, with the text "lessig2016.us" in the top right corner. The video then moves to a lecture hall where a man in a black outfit is addressing an attentive audience, with the same text "lessig2016.us" displayed in the top right corner. The video alternates between close-up shots of the man in the light blue shirt and the man in the black outfit speaking to the audience, maintaining the "lessig2016.us" text in the top right corner throughout. The video concludes with a black screen.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker explaining his path to becoming a professor, citing his inability to focus on uninteresting problems. He then mentions being drawn into activism as a law professor, particularly involving the internet. Throughout the speech, the tone is conversational. The background features gentle, orchestral music evoking a sense of thoughtfulness.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing glasses and a light blue shirt, speaking in front of a plain background with a subtle light source. The text "lessig2016.us" is visible in the top right corner, indicating a connection to a website or event. The scene transitions to a stage where the same man is giving a TED talk, with a large screen behind him displaying the text "(re)negotiating" and two smaller screens showing his image. The audience is visible in the foreground, attentively watching the presentation. The video then returns to the man in the light blue shirt, continuing his speech with a focused expression. The background remains consistent, with the text "lessig2016.us" still visible. The video concludes with a close-up of the man, emphasizing his facial expressions and gestures as he speaks.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker, discussing the potential for creativity and commerce, and how people can connect. He notes, "these tools of creativity have become tools of speech". The speaker then observes the Internetâ€™s amazing features related to privacy and free speech, pointing out that government and private industry have an interest in changing the code, wanting to "surveil everything you do" and control free speech. A mellow, jazzy piano music underscores his points, with a light, thoughtful mood. The clip concludes with a female speaker softly uttering "to let me leave them".

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a series of American flags waving against a sunset sky, creating a patriotic atmosphere. The scene transitions to a man in a suit and tie, seated in front of a scenic backdrop, suggesting a formal interview or talk show setting. The text 'lessig2016.us' appears, indicating a connection to a campaign or event. The focus then shifts to another man in a dark blazer and light shirt, seated in a similar setting, reinforcing the interview or discussion theme. The video then moves to a man in a light blue shirt, speaking in a warmly lit room, adding a personal touch to the narrative. The scene transitions to a classroom setting where a man in a black shirt is giving a lecture to a group of attentive students, highlighting an educational context. The video then shows a Google+ Hangout interface, featuring a man in a suit and tie, suggesting a virtual meeting or discussion. The final scene features a man in a dark shirt, seated in a room with curtains, continuing the interview or discussion theme. Throughout the video, the recurring text 'lessig2016.us' ties the various scenes together, indicating a cohesive campaign or event narrative.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a serious male voice stating that the majority of the public agrees the spying is necessary but warns that it could be an unprecedented infringement on civil liberties, as said by Laurence Lessig. Another male speaker explains that the last 20 years have shown increasing changes to enable massive surveillance. This speaker is followed by the introduction of Edward Snowden on the screen, signaled by the speaker's excitement. Applause is heard after the introduction. A serious, authoritative male speaker states he had the authority to wiretap anyone, from an accountant to a judge or the president. At the very end, only silence remains.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man wearing glasses and a light blue shirt, speaking directly to the camera against a dark background. The text "lessig2016.us" is visible in the top right corner, indicating a possible connection to a campaign or website. The man's expressions and head movements suggest he is engaged in a conversation or delivering a message. The lighting highlights his face, creating a focused and professional atmosphere. The video maintains a consistent setting and tone throughout, with the man's gestures and facial expressions conveying a sense of earnestness and engagement.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker reflecting on how he "became increasingly active in trying to push back" against excessive internet regulation. His tone is thoughtful and explanatory. He specifies that "copyright was the first big area of that fight," but it wasn't the only one. The clip ends on a statement and fades away, leaving the impression that the speaker may still be talking.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a light blue shirt and glasses, standing against a dark background with a subtle light source behind him, creating a focused and serious atmosphere. The text "lessig2016.us" is visible in the top right corner, indicating a connection to a campaign or event related to 2016. The scene transitions to a man in a dark suit and tie, seated in front of a red background, speaking passionately and gesturing with his hands, suggesting he is delivering a speech or presentation. The text "LESSIG 2016" is repeatedly displayed in the background, reinforcing the campaign theme. The video then shifts to a conversation between two men seated at a table, with one man in a black suit and the other in a dark suit, engaged in a discussion. The background features a bookshelf with various items, including books and decorative objects, adding a personal and intellectual ambiance to the setting. The text "lessig2016.us" remains visible, maintaining the campaign's branding throughout the video. The overall atmosphere is professional and focused, with the men appearing engaged and attentive to the conversation.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with male speech characterized by an emphatic tone, declaring "copyright is eternal," and expressing strong disapproval of remixing the interview. A second male voice interjects with a more relaxed tone, stating they are a joint copyright owner and are okay with remixing. The first male speaker then expresses support for network neutrality. Throughout the clip, the background contains low level crowd noise, suggesting a public setting.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a protest scene where a diverse group of people is holding signs against PIPA, with messages like "It's no longer OK to NOT know how the Internet works. STOP PIPA" and "Stand up for your rights on the Internet. Stop PIPA." The crowd is behind metal barricades, and the setting appears to be an urban street with tall buildings in the background. The scene then transitions to a close-up of a man wearing glasses and a light blue shirt, speaking directly to the camera against a plain, neutral background. The text "lessig2016.us" is visible in the top right corner, indicating a possible campaign or website related to the man. The video continues with the same man, now shown from a slightly different angle, still speaking and maintaining a serious expression. The background remains consistent, with the text "lessig2016.us" still visible. The scene then shifts to a close-up of another man with a beard, wearing a gray sweater, in an indoor setting with blurred figures in the background, suggesting a casual or informal environment. The video then transitions to a laptop screen displaying the Wikipedia logo, featuring a globe made of puzzle pieces with the text "Wikipedia The Free Encyclopedia" below it. The URL "www.wikipedia.org" is visible at the top of the screen, indicating the Wikipedia website. The video concludes with this image, emphasizing the importance of Wikipedia as a free and accessible source of information.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip opens with a male speaker discussing a concept once known as "open access," now called "net neutrality," and its role in guaranteeing competition with broadband providers. He mentions his book and its publication in the late 90s as the internet was becoming popular. He recalls being contacted by Jimmy Wales before Wikipedia existed, and Wales asked if he could help.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a black and white image of a smiling man with long hair, followed by a scene of a man in a light blue shirt and glasses speaking in a warmly lit room. The scene transitions to an outdoor setting where a man in a black suit converses with a young boy in a black t-shirt and jeans, with a backpack beside him. The video then shifts to a man in a white shirt and black vest standing at a podium with a laptop, delivering a speech in a room with red walls and geometric patterns. The man continues to speak, with close-up shots emphasizing his expressions and gestures. The video concludes with a return to the man in the light blue shirt, now in a different setting, speaking with a serious expression. Throughout the video, the text 'lessig2016.us' appears in the top right corner, indicating a connection to a campaign or event related to the year 2016.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker reminiscing about meeting Aaron Swartz at speaking events, describing him as a young, engaged kid asking smart questions. The speaker then shifts to recounting a conversation with Aaron seven years prior, focusing on his pointed question about solving problems like copyright policy given government corruption. The speaker recalls his initial deflection and Aaron's follow-up about the speaker's role as a citizen. A new male speaker describes Aaron Swartz as an internet genius focused on making the world a better place, with calm, serious tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man wearing glasses and a light blue shirt, standing against a dark background with a spotlight effect. The text "lessig2016.us" is visible in the top right corner. The scene transitions to a close-up of a computer screen displaying various websites, including "The Center for Internet and Society," "Electronic Frontier Foundation," and "Creative Commons." The next scene shows two individuals standing side by side, one wearing a gray sweatshirt with the "Creative Commons" logo and the other in a black jacket over a blue shirt. The background features framed pictures on a wall. The video then shifts to a man with long hair, wearing a black shirt with the text "Democracy Now!" and a yellow lanyard, speaking in front of a dark background. The text "lessig2016.us" remains in the top right corner. The scene changes to an outdoor setting where a man in a red shirt with the same "Democracy Now!" text is talking to another person. The video then shows a man in a black vest over a blue shirt, standing in front of a blue background with the "Harvard University" logo repeated across it. The text "lessig2016.us" is still visible in the top right corner. The video concludes with the same man in the black vest, continuing to speak in front of the Harvard University backdrop.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing the launch of a project called "Creative Commons", mentioning that someone named Aaron was recommended as the Chief Technology Officer.  There's a somber shift as a female speaker announces that Aaron Swartz committed suicide, having hung himself in his Brooklyn apartment.  A male speaker then states that the government would not stop until he admitted he was a felon.  Another male speaker comments that "in a world where...the architects of the financial crisis dine regularly at the White House, it's ridiculous to think Aaron Swartz was a felon."

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a person wearing a black t-shirt with the text "DEMOCRACY NOW!" and a yellow lanyard with a badge, sitting in front of a laptop with an Apple logo. The background is dark, and the text "LESSIG 2016" and "lessig2016.us" are visible on the screen, indicating the event or organization associated with the video. The scene transitions to a close-up of another individual wearing glasses and a light blue shirt, with the text "lessig2016.us" displayed in the top right corner. The background is a plain, neutral color, and the lighting is soft, creating a professional atmosphere. The video then shows a map highlighting the state of New Hampshire, with the text "Dixville Notch" and "Nashua" marked on it, indicating specific locations within the state. The map is overlaid on a background image of a snowy landscape, suggesting a connection to the geographical context of the event. The video returns to the close-up of the individual in the light blue shirt, maintaining the same professional and neutral background. The video concludes with the same individual, reinforcing the focus on the speaker and the event's branding.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker posing analogies around BitTorrent usage and web page loading, characterized by a thoughtful and somewhat philosophical tone. This shifts to another male speaker, expressing an "urgency to make that death not meaningless" with heightened seriousness. He continues, explaining that on January 11th, the anniversary of someone named Aaron's death, a walk began and concluded on January 24th, with "200 people joined us." The speaker then mentions arriving on the anniversary of "Granny D's" birth, speaking with a respectful intonation.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a light blue shirt and glasses speaking against a beige wall with a decorative light fixture. The scene transitions to an outdoor setting where an elderly person wearing an orange safety vest and a green jacket walks uphill, using a walking stick for support. The background is lush with greenery, indicating a natural environment. The next scene shows the same person walking on a paved road, still using the walking stick, with a backdrop of trees and a clear sky. The video then shifts to a close-up of a race bib on the vest, reading 'GRANNY D FOR CAMPAIGN,' suggesting a political or advocacy campaign. The scene changes to a wider shot of the person walking on a sidewalk in an urban area, with a Pizza Hut sign visible in the background, indicating a commercial setting. The video continues with the person walking alongside another individual in a red jacket and white gloves, both using walking sticks, in a snowy environment with a truck passing by. The final scene shows the person holding a sign that reads 'SORT FOR PIZZA' in front of a Pizza Hut, with snow-covered mountains in the background, emphasizing the campaign's message. Throughout the video, the text 'lessig2016.us' appears, indicating a connection to a campaign or website.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker describing Granny D's walk from Los Angeles to Washington D.C. for campaign finance reform. His tone is informative and serious. He then describes astonishment at discovering the passion and anger surrounding this issue. The tone turns more reflective and surprised.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with two individuals in high-visibility jackets standing outdoors, one in a bright yellow jacket and the other in an orange vest, amidst a wooded area. The scene transitions to a person in a blue jacket walking through a snowy landscape, with the text '96%' prominently displayed, suggesting a statistic or percentage. The snowy scene continues, showing the person in the blue jacket alongside the two individuals in high-visibility jackets, with the '96%' text still visible. The video then shifts to an indoor setting, featuring two men seated at a news desk, engaged in a conversation. The background displays a world map, and the text 'LESSIG 2016' and 'lessig2016.us' appear, indicating a possible event or campaign. The scene transitions to a close-up of a man in a light blue shirt and glasses, speaking against a plain background, with the text 'lessig2016.us' in the top right corner, reinforcing the event or campaign theme. The video maintains a focus on this individual, emphasizing his speech and expressions, with the background remaining consistent and the text 'lessig2016.us' persistently displayed.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker, in a serious tone, referencing a poll where "96% of Americans" believe in reducing "the influence of money in politics" because "money buys results in Congress." He continues to describe how a primary requirement "to be able to run for office" is to raise funds "from a tiny fraction of the 1%." This is interspersed with cinematic musical scoring, which swells in the background.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a black and white family portrait featuring a man, a woman, and three children sitting on the grass in front of a hedge. The man and woman are seated in the back, with the woman on the left and the man on the right, both smiling and looking at the camera. The three children are seated in front of them, with the two boys on the left and the girl on the right, all dressed in white shirts and jeans. The scene then transitions to a close-up of a man wearing glasses and a light blue shirt, speaking against a dark background. The text "lessig2016.us" appears in the top right corner, indicating a website related to the content. The man continues to speak, with slight variations in his facial expressions and head movements, suggesting he is engaged in a conversation or delivering a message. The background remains consistent throughout these frames, maintaining a professional and focused atmosphere. The video concludes with the man still speaking, emphasizing the importance of his message.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a man speaking thoughtfully about fatherhood, stating "the one really great thing about being a father is to dream of the future of your children," and emphasizing the desire to create a future for them that one is proud of.  Following the man's speech, there is a "cough."

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a nighttime scene of the United States Capitol building, illuminated and surrounded by numerous American flags waving in the wind. The scene transitions to a daytime view of the Washington Monument, with the American flag prominently displayed against a clear blue sky. A close-up of a man wearing glasses and a light blue shirt follows, with the text 'lessig2016.us' visible in the top right corner, indicating a political campaign website. The video then shifts to a stock market trading floor, showing a person in a dark suit and tie, with stock market data displayed on screens in the background. The scene transitions to a street sign reading 'Wall St,' with the text 'lessig2016.us' still visible. The video then shows a nighttime view of the Lincoln Memorial, with people gathered around the statue, and the text 'lessig2016.us' remains in the top right corner. The final scene features a daytime view of the United States Capitol building, with people walking around the area, and the text 'lessig2016.us' continues to be displayed. The video concludes with a close-up of the man in the light blue shirt, with the text 'lessig2016.us' still visible in the top right corner.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker talking about how "corruption is tied," in a somewhat serious tone, and mentions a fundamental inequality in American political power development. He observes how people may focus on climate change dangers, debt, or the economy, but then emphasizes that all these issues are linked to "the corrupting influence of money and politics."

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a man in a light blue shirt, wearing glasses, speaking against a dark background with a spotlight effect. The text "lessig2016.us" is visible in the top right corner, indicating a campaign website. The scene transitions to a television studio where the same man, now in a black suit, is seated and speaking, with a backdrop featuring an orange globe and an eagle statue. The text "LESSIG 2016" is repeatedly displayed in the background. The video then returns to the man in the light blue shirt, with the text "lessig2016.us" still visible. The scene shifts to a news studio where the man, now in a dark suit, is speaking with a cityscape in the background. The text "ALL IN CHRIS HAYES" and "LIVE MSNBC" appears at the top, and "LESSIG FOR PRESIDENT" is displayed at the bottom, indicating a live broadcast. The video then shows a busy street scene with people walking, followed by a protest at night with a large banner reading "LIVES MATTER" and signs saying "Justice NO PEACE." The text "lessig2016.us" remains visible throughout. The video concludes with a graphic displaying the text "FIX DEMOCRACY FIRST" in blue and red, emphasizing the campaign's focus on democratic reform.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a somber musical piece that sets an earnest tone, featuring orchestral elements and strings. As the music fades slightly, a male speaker introduces the concept of citizens "at the front of the line," followed by the idea that governments "bend over backwards to serve" certain individuals. Another male speaker talks about congress, touching on the idea that "the system is rigged" and how it influences public policy.  He expresses an optimistic view that members of congress believe they can help, but get caught in a system that corrupts democracy. A third male speaker emphasizes equality and the commitment to erasing inequality, accompanied by background music that supports the serious nature of the discussion. The clip concludes with the music gaining in volume, creating a dramatic finish.
